material.mattext:
Quiz 8 - Trajectory generation

This quiz covers Chapter 7 of the notes.

 Instructions

  • This quiz consists of 10 questions, covering content from the previous week.
  • You are allowed to submit the quiz an unlimited number of times with no time limit, and on each submission you can review each incorrect question attempt after the fact.
  • When reattempting the quiz, only the previously incorrect question(s) from the last attempted quiz will be available to attempt. The correct question(s) from the last attempted quiz will automatically be added to your score.

Considering a cubic polynomial time-scaling function of the form

$$s(t)=a_0+a_1t+a_2t^2+a_3t^3,$$

determine \(\{a_0,a_1,a_2,a_3\}\) when \(T=10\) seconds and

$$\{s(0),\dot{s}(0),s(T),\dot{s}(T)\}=\{0,0,1,0 \}.$$

Considering a cubic polynomial of the form

$$s(t)=a_0+a_1t+a_2t^2+a_3t^3,$$

determine the maximum acceleration, \(\ddot{s}_{max}=max\{|\ddot{s}(t)|\}\), when \(T=10\) seconds and

$$\{s(0),\dot{s}(0),s(T),\dot{s}(T)\}=\{0,0,1,0 \}.$$
Given the trajectory profiles below of a cubic polynomial, determine the polynomial coefficients when $$X(t)=a_0+a_1t+a_2t^2+a_3t^3.$$
Given the trajectory profiles below of a cubic polynomial, determine the polynomial coefficients when \(s(t)=a_0+a_1t+a_2t^2+a_3t^3\).
Given the figure below, determine the type of trajectory given by \(s(t)\).
Trapezoidal velocity profiles are intended for energy-optimal trajectories that demand low energy to move from point to point.
Correct! Trapezoidal velocity profiles are intended for time-optimal trajectories that attempt to minimise the time taken to move from point to point.
The position at the half termination time of a trapezoidal velocity profile, \( s(\frac{T}{2})\), is given by
Given the trapezoidal velocity profile below, determine \(a\) and \(v\).
Given a trapezoidal velocity profile with parameters \(s(0)=0\) m, \(a=2\) ms\(^{-2}\) and \(v=10\) ms\(^{-1}\), determine the position at the end of phase 1, namely \(s(t_a)\),
Determine the total displacement along a trapezoidal velocity profile, namely \(s(T)-s(0)\).
